context: otitis media:

text: infection of the middle ear space
context: is an infection of the middle ear space where the small bones and nerves of the ear connect to the eardrum on one side and the eustachian tube on the other.
where the small bones and nerves of the ear connect to the eardrum on one side and the eustachian tube on the other.
the ear infection itself is not contagious but the respiratory infection preceding it is transmittable.

otitis media is most often seen in infants and young children.
